title: People Try Vegan Cheese For The First Time

comments.text:
People's preferences don't affect you. Some people are very 
vegan/organic/natural and some people prefer to have processed food or 
meat, etc. It doesn't matter. I like chicken and fish but no other meats 
really, and using nuts as cheese probably won't taste like cheese, but who 
cares what others want to eat?﻿

comments.author: Bruno Coutinho

comments.text:
Vegetarian diets can cause the death of animals too. According to a 2003 
study by Steven Davis at Oregon State University, about six animals per 
acre, or 52-77% of the animals (such as birds, mice, and rabbits) that live 
in agricultural crop fields, are killed during harvest.

Eating meat is not cruel or unethical; it is a natural part of the cycle of 
life. Vegetarians mistakenly elevate the value of animal life over plant 
life. Research shows that plants respond electrochemically to threats and 
may feel fear, so vegetarians are also causing harm every time they kill 
and eat a plant. Every organism on earth dies or is killed, at some point, 
so others organisms can live. There is nothing wrong with this cycle; it is 
how nature works.

What you put in your body is your business, but don't think you're better 
than anyone else for not eating meat. Eating meat has been an essential 
part of human evolution for 2.3 million years.﻿
comments.author: Michael Woods

comments.text:
+Michael Woods

*«Life is only possible through death.»*
Death is not the issue : Suffering is, so this argument is pointless.

_«What is harder on Mother Earth?»
Fairytale, man. As god, btw.

*«Me taking my bow out into the woods and harvesting a deer.»*
Please let your shoes in. And your clothes too. And your car keys, and 
watch, and pills, and your phone and money. And give me this bow, it's 
unnatural.

«Or you clear cutting a forest, turning it into a field and planting a 
crop? Without fossil fuels bringing you (from far off lands) your 
vegetables you would not be able to live your vegetarian lifestyle. Have 
you done your homework?»
As cattle need huge amount of corn and soya to grow, it's rather (and from 
far) meat  production that pollute.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cattle_feeding#Corn-fed  Cattle literally eat 
and shit more than 60% of water and cereals ( *and not grass* ) resources 
in western countries for a very weak meat production, due to bioconversion.

http://www.viande.info/english/files/pictures/diagrams/water-need-for-food/water-need-for-food-600x450.png
https://h2theno.files.wordpress.com/2014/05/wwf-graph.jpg
http://www.npr.org/news/graphics/2012/06/gr-burgers-462.gif

It's a massive waste of ressource...and, as you need a great amount of corn 
to feed cows, you need fertilizer, pesticides and water to let the 
productive wheat grow, you pollute indirectly the ground more than 
necessary.
As corn proteins are not balanced in amino -acid, you need soya to complete 
it. And, as beef need great amount of soya, you need to import it from a 
country where the soya crops are a disaster for environment. (even if the 
soya cultivated to make tofu or soya milk are often made in your country! 
Because as you eat it directly, you don't need to produce great
amounts of it quickly)

Yes, I have done my homeworks. With sources. And please, stop discrediting 
yourself, it's embarassing.

*« Agriculture rapes the land.»*
You said it, man : read my argument above, stop eating meat and all will be 
fine.

 _«Hunting works with the land harmoniously.*  _Take what you need from the 
land. Or you can force the land to do what you want to suit your needs. 
Seems pretty selfish.»*
Again, you said it. Please stop accusing yourself, and simply go vegan.

*«I take what I am allowed from the forest and supplement that with grass 
fed, free range animals that are local to me.»*
Nope. As we have seen it above, you don't.

*«Where does your food come from as a vegetarian?»*
Big ignorance in approach...

*« Just guessing, but I bet you have no idea.»*
*HAHAHAHAHAHA!*
Sorry, but you become ridiculous, and it's funny!

*«When vegetables are out of season, where do you think they come from?»*
Oh...you mean the soya to feed cattle? Let me gess...see above?

*«This will be my final response to you as you don't deserve anymore of my 
time.»*
Very well done, kiddoo
having a ball rolling around in the mud and sand by himself, it's always 
distracting.

*«Do yourself a favor and research where your food comes from, and at what 
cost.»*
Now you know you see the mote in my eye but not the beam in your own.

But *please* : If you come back, bring *evidences* , not childish beliefs.

As a conclusion, I would say you have a totally distorted vision of 
agroeconomic system, believing Nature validate the industrial farms issue 
(95% of meat products) and that the vegan aim is to preserve "life and 
gaïa".
It's false.

Hey, someone have liked your comment, kiddoo, you have a 
friend!...Oh...Okay, sorry....
comments.author: crabe

comments.text:
+crabe Life is only possible through death. What is harder on Mother Earth? 
Me taking my bow out into the woods and harvesting a deer. Or you clear 
cutting a forest, turning it into a field and planting a crop? Without 
fossil fuels bringing you (from far off lands) your vegetables you would 
not be able to live your vegetarian lifestyle. Have you done your homework? 
Agriculture rapes the land. Hunting works with the land harmoniously. Take 
what you need from the land. Or you can force the land to do what you want 
to suit your needs. Seems pretty selfish.  I take what I am allowed from 
the forest and supplement that with grass fed, free range animals that are 
local to me. Locally grown vegetables are also a part of my diet. I support 
my local economy and eat healthy at the same time. Where does your food 
come from as a vegetarian? Just guessing, but I bet you have no idea. When 
vegetables are out of season, where do you think they come from? I'm gonna 
go out on a limb and say that they don't come from anywhere local to 
you. This will be my final response to you as you don't deserve anymore of 
my time. Do yourself a favor and research where your food comes from, and 
at what cost.
comments.author: Michael Woods

comments.text:
+Michael Woods 
About the 2003 study : According to more recent studies, it's false :
http://www.animalvisuals.org/projects/data/1mc
With more serious scientifical sources.

All the arguments following are not real arguments : They are merely 
fallacies.
Well known fallacies.

*«Eating meat is not cruel or unethical»*
No. But 95% of modern industrial means to raise cattle are cruel and 
unethical

*«it is a natural part of the cycle of life»*
http://www.godfist.com/vegansidekick//guide/#a16

*«Vegetarians mistakenly elevate the value of animal life over plant life»*
No : scientists do
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0003347209003571
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirror_test

*«Research shows that plants respond electrochemically to threats and may 
feel fear, so vegetarians are also causing harm every time they kill and 
eat a plant.»*
No. Sorry, but it's a stupid to interpret a reaction as a sentience.
Moreover : 
https://www.facebook.com/vegansidekick/photos/pb.450350651726063.-2207520000.1414925227./694625453965247/?type=3&permPage=1

*«Every organism on earth dies or is killed, at some point, so others 
organisms can live. There is nothing wrong with this cycle; it is how 
nature works».*
It's a repetition of your second fallacy. See above.

*«What you put in your body is your business, but don't think you're better 
than anyone else for not eating meat».*
As anti homophobia activist or feminist, vegan don't think they are better. 
They just want to tell to everyone what I will tell you below.

*«Eating meat has been an essential part of human evolution for 2.3 million 
years».*
Slavery too. But not industrial farms (95% of actual production)

As you show it in your comment, you don't understand very well the reason 
to be vegan. Please, let me explain you the *real* reasons to eat salad 
instead of steak and cheese ^^
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
It appears that eating meat is not useful to be healthy. Vegan diet is not 
a "perfect" diet, but it works.

You can live without eating meat :
http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/89/5/1627S.full

corollary : you eat meat just for pleasure and tradition
And it's fine. pleasure is good...except if it's immoral and incredibly bad 
for environment

In the past, there were regular farms, with cows eating grass and pigs 
eating food leftovers.Not anymore :to feed 4 billons of humans in western 
country, twice a day, with meat, you need industrial efficiency, 
rationalisation and optimisation of meat production.That's the issue.

Actually, there's 58.000.000.000 farm animals on this planet raised by us 
to feed us... But it's not necessary anymore for health.

Moreover, they don't drink just one glass of water , they don't eat a grass 
catch before reaching adulthood in one day . They literally eat and shit 
more than 60% of water and cereals (and not grass) resources in western 
countries for a very weak meat production, due to bioconversion.

It's a massive waste of ressource...and, as you need a great amount of corn 
to feed cows, you need fertilizer, pesticides and water to let the 
productive wheat grow, you pollute indirectly the ground more than 
necessary.

Moreover, there's cattle welfare big issue, due to modern industrial 
production devices.
First of all : I have nothing against killing animals to eat their meat... 
if it's painless .

Farm animals, as big mammals, are quite sentients. (= they can feel pain)
Animals sentience and awareness is a very complicated debate, and I won't 
argue (I'm quite ignorant about it).

Just know, roughly speaking, that a pig is more clever than a dog :
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mirror_test
And we keep 95% of pigs in it :
https://www.bing.com/images/search?q=gestation+crate+pig&FORM=HDRSC2

Without moving, in the dark. All their life. We ampute their tails, teeth, 
testicles, and make them injections, to be able to raise them in crates. 
and it's not an exception from a "bad farm", at all.
Dairy is not harmless either : A cow need to be pregnant to produce milk. 
Hence, a cow is inseminated to produce milk. You inseminate her non-stop 
for three year before it finish exhausted (otherwise it can live 20 years) 
and always kill its male calf, as you don't need it.
In the same way, for hen and chicks : useless, all male chicks are killed. 
It's not a big issue (for me), but there's the welfare issue remaining :
https://www.bing.com/images/search?q=battery+hen&FORM=HDRSC2

I won't go further, but there's a lot of details remaining.

Veganism is just the easiest, laziest (yes) way to no abuse animals, 
respect environment and show that we must drastically reduce our meat and 
dairy consumption.
comments.author: crabe

I'm not a vegan, I eat everything. None of the vegetarian meat and cheese 
substitutes taste like the real thing to me, but some are tasty 
nonetheless. Tofutti Better Than Cream Cheese, Lightlife Smart Bacon, and 
Tofurky Beer Brats are the best I've found so far. Thing is, a lot of these 
things are mostly made of heavily processed soy and wheat gluten which are 
inflammatory for many people, so don't think you're doing yourself any 
favors by eating them.﻿
comments.author: Kaiser Frost

comments.text:
Ok let's get this straight. If you're vegan that's cool, If you consume 
animal products that's cool too. Bashing someone just because of their 
lifestyle choices like that is just plain rude and immature. Everyone needs 
to get off their high horses and quit arguing over such a pointless topic. 
Not everyone will want to be vegan and not everyone will want to consume 
animal products, just agree to disagree.﻿

we weren't meant to eat it you wouldn't enjoy it and try to recreate it.﻿
